summary: Executive Assistant/Office Manager with experience managing employees, improving productivity and reducing costs; proficient in calendar management, travel planning, vendor negotiations, and cross-functional coordination.

experience.title: Executive Assistant/Office Manager
experience.description: Manage calendars for multiple executives; maintain daily communication with President, VP, CFO, COO and Director; research and schedule international/domestic travel; prepare and distribute revenue reports; review and enter accounts payable invoices; manage vendor/meeting logistics; oversee corporate credit card and cellular accounts; coordinate Engineering drawings; prepare meeting agendas and minutes; oversee major projects (e.g., Louisiana building expansion); analyze Master Service Agreements/NDAs; prepare expense reports; travel to Louisiana for major meetings; plan holiday events.

experience.title: Certified Fitness Trainer
experience.description: Enhance monthly revenue through client referrals and satisfaction; implement marketing strategies to attract clients; initiate and manage appointments and training sessions; provide attentive, client-focused service; ensure timely action and follow-up; build trust through consistent client interactions; coordinate and track weight-loss statistics to tailor programs.

experience.title: Demo Representative
experience.description: Increased revenue at Expositions and Demonstrations with top sales for two consecutive years; improved productivity by developing sampling techniques; engage customers in diverse settings; perform live sampling; enhance product knowledge; manage travel schedules and client meetings; document impact of demonstrations; build and maintain internal/external relationships; manage monthly budgets.

experience.title: Legal Assistant/Office Manager
experience.description: Improve monthly invoices by enforcing credit terms; review, proofread, and format invoices and income/expense reports; research and interpret legal documents under deadlines; oversee mediations, depositions, and meetings; coordinate procedures for new clients to increase court filing efficiency; perform communications with public/private/government agencies; manage advertising, marketing, scheduling, and collections; train and supervise seasonal staff; organize physical and electronic client files; oversee main schedule and time management; maintain high attention to detail and administrative efficiency.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Psychology & English
Associate of Arts in English Language

certifications: AHA First Aid, CPR, AED Training Certification
Oxygen Usage & Safety Awareness Training Certification
Bloodbourne Pathogen OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.1030(g)(2)(i) Training Certification
